DataElement.preferredName: Specimen Requirement Tissue Site ICD-O-3 Topography Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A sample or part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:Something that is necessary; condition, something that is obligatory._An aggregate of cells with similar or identical specialized characteristics, contributing to the performance of a specific function.  Tissues are parts of organs.  Representative examples include epithelium, lymphoid tissue, and connective tissue.:A position in relation to its surroundings._Codes representing the ICD-10 classification coding site (topography) of malignant neoplasms (except those categories which relate to secondary neoplasms and to specified morphological types of tumours) for all types of tumors.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A sample or part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:Something that is necessary; condition, something that is obligatory._An aggregate of cells with similar or identical specialized characteristics, contributing to the performance of a specific function.  Tissues are parts of organs.  Representative examples include epithelium, lymphoid tissue, and connective tissue.:A position in relation to its surroundings.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A sample or part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:Something that is necessary; condition, something that is obligatory.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: An aggregate of cells with similar or identical specialized characteristics, contributing to the performance of a specific function.  Tissues are parts of organs.  Representative examples include epithelium, lymphoid tissue, and connective tissue.:A position in relation to its surroundings.

Concepts.definition: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.
A position in relation to its surroundings.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Codes representing the ICD-10 classification coding site (topography) of malignant neoplasms (except those categories which relate to secondary neoplasms and to specified morphological types of tumours) for all types of tumors.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, third edition (ICD-O-3).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
